document_data.name: Granite Destrier
document_data.distinctions: Vague shape, six legs, vulpine head, flat back, seats optional
document_data.mainbody: A '''granite destrier''' was an [[elemental]] of bizarre appearance, with a broad, flat, strong back. The [[dwarven]] [[geomancer]] [[Thormud Horn]] could summon one for transport.
document_data.Description: The granite destrier summoned by Thormud Horn had a vague shape with six pillar-like legs, a vulpine head, and two seat-like depressions on its flat back. It was probably made of [[granite]].
document_data.Abilities: Granite destriers carried extremely large loads tirelessly and as fast as the fastest [[horse]] at full gallop.{{cite book/Darkvision|36-37|4}} They were not impeded by most terrain, being perfectly capable of making treks across hills{{cite book/Darkvision|70-71|8}} or even mountains.{{cite book/Darkvision|176-178|19}} The number of seats was adjustable by the summoner.
document_data.Combat: The granite destrier that Thormud Horn summoned never engaged in combat, even on those occasions its master was in mortal danger.{{cite book/Darkvision|80-82|8}}{{cite book/Darkvision|133-137|14}}
document_data.Notable Granite Destriers: Thormud Horn summoned a granite destrier in the {{yearlinkName|1374}}, as he habitually did when he needed to travel.
